questions.question: When should you unfold your napkin and place it on your lap?

choices.answer: As soon as you sit down.
When you need to wipe your face.

questions.question: It is acceptable to start eating when your food arrives at your table, when others have not.

imageMetadata.resources: It is NOT acceptable to start eating until, everyone at the table has received their food.

questions.resources: It is NOT acceptable to start eating until, everyone at the table has received their food.

questions.question: By resting your fork & knife on either side of your plate, represents what?

imageMetadata.resources: This indicates you are "still eating." That way the waiter does not remove your plate.

questions.resources: This indicates you are "still eating." That way the waiter does not remove your plate.

questions.question: When you are finished with your meal, where do you place your silverware?

choices.answer: Making a triangle shape, center of the plate.
On either side of the plate.
Side by side, in the center of the plate.

imageMetadata.resources: When you finish your meal,  place your silverware side by side, in the center of the plate. This indicates you are through. That way the waiter can clear your plate.

questions.resources: When you finish your meal,  place your silverware side by side, in the center of the plate. This indicates you are through. That way the waiter can clear your plate.

questions.question: On what side of the table are the forks and knives on?

imageMetadata.resources: The forks are placed on the LEFT side of the plate. While the knives are on the RIGHT. Spoons are placed after the knife.

questions.resources: The forks are placed on the LEFT side of the plate. While the knives are on the RIGHT. Spoons are placed after the knife.

questions.question: If bread is served, how should it be cut?

choices.answer: Break a piece of bread off with your fingers.
Start cutting a piece for everyone.
Cut a slice and eat it.

imageMetadata.resources: Surprisingly, you break bread with your fingers, is the proper way to do it. This way you're not making a crumby mess while cutting a piece off.

questions.resources: Surprisingly, you break bread with your fingers, is the proper way to do it. This way you're not making a crumby mess while cutting a piece off.

questions.question: What side is your Bread Plate on?

imageMetadata.resources: Your bread plate is located at the top LEFT of the plate.

questions.resources: Your bread plate is located at the top LEFT of the plate.

questions.question: What does it mean when the Salt & Pepper are married?

choices.answer: They should be passed together, & passed to the LEFT.
They should be passed together, & passed to the RIGHT!

imageMetadata.resources: When someone asks you to pass the Salt. Always pass the Salt & Pepper together.  Make sure to pass things to your RIGHT.

questions.resources: When someone asks you to pass the Salt. Always pass the Salt & Pepper together.  Make sure to pass things to your RIGHT.

questions.question: Where do you place your Napkin, when you must leave the table temporarily?

choices.answer: On the table, beside your plate.

imageMetadata.resources: When you must leave the table temporarily, like go to the bathroom or take a phone call. Place your napkin on the chair. This indicates that you are coming back, so the waiter does not clear your plate.

questions.resources: When you must leave the table temporarily, like go to the bathroom or take a phone call. Place your napkin on the chair. This indicates that you are coming back, so the waiter does not clear your plate.
